archimate:ApplicationFunction.name: (lae-F18) To manage users
archimate:ApplicationFunction.documentation: Auto --- R1 F18 BRD-SEC-010 Users rights and access control The system shall have built-in privilege (user rights) and access control capabilities sufficient to restrict individual users or defined groups (roles) of users access to data and/or transactions required for their specific work. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-020 User identifications The system shall be able to provide individual (nominative) user identifications. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-030 Password rules The system shall be able to enforce password rules (length, complexity, change cycle). R1 F18 BRD-SEC-040 No Hard-coded passwords The system shall not contain hard-coded passwords. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-050 Passwords over the network The system shall not transmit passwords in clear over the network. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-060 Store passwords The system shall not store passwords in clear. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-070 Change initial passwords Prior to entry into production, initial passwords for default/admin accounts as provided by the vendors must be changed according to password rules. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-080 No Unauthenticated users The system shall not allow “guest” or “anonymous” accounts (unauthenticated users). Such accounts must be disabled. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-090 Security – logging and monitoring The system shall provide logging and monitoring capabilities for successful and unsuccessful user log-on and log-off, and use of administrator privileges. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-100 Anti-virus and patch management The system shall be able to be included in anti-virus and patch management mechanisms. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-110 Encrypted connections It shall be ensured that any connection to other sites (or third party) is encrypted. R1 F18 BRD-SEC-120 Information assets control All assets should be accounted for and have a nominal owner who’s responsible for it. Accountability should be assured. Assets include: · Data in databases and files, system documentation, manuals, training materials,… · Software · Computer and communication equipment, tapes, disks and auxiliary equipment. · Services
